title: Support Prometheus node-exporter VM metrics monitoring
body:
### Support Prometheus node-exporter VM metrics monitoring
- [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc.
- [ ] Update the documentation to include this new feature.
- [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature.
- [X] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.
     

- [X] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #6108.
- [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

Since we define the VM entity as a service in OAP, I use `vm::`  as a prefix in MAL to identify.
### VM Metrics flow
Prometheus node-exporter ---(pull)---> OpenTelemetry-collector ---(push)---> (otel-receiver)OAP server
### Monitored metrics
- CPU Average Used
- CPU Load
- Memory RAM
- Memory Swap
- File System
- Disk R/W
- Network Bandwidth Usage
- Network Status
- Filefd Allocated

The above metrcs support Linux, has bean tested with `node_exporter-1.0.1.linux-amd64` in Ubuntu16 & CentOS7
### Screenshots

![1611819908548](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16773043/106216295-c8ecef80-620d-11eb-818b-a5611244e8fb.jpg)
![1611829577489](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16773043/106216454-1bc6a700-620e-11eb-90b5-661dfe8fc2dc.jpg)

@vcjmhg I am informing you that, I am deleting a plugin you contributed in the 8.4.0 iterator, and it will not be included in the official release. The reason I am doing this is because, the log feature is closing ready.
You can see the progress from https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/5930, we are waiting for the last piece from UI side only, we have gRPC reporter for log4j/log4j2/logback, w/ or w/o Satellite, and OAP backend supports.

You also could see from https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/420, @Fine0830 is supporting the log-trace collaboration in the UI too.

As this new implementation doesn't require to wait for the segment finish signal, it will cost less memory, and local Satellite could provide file cache mechanism(@EvanLjp leads that project). We should recommend users to take the latest and more powerful solution.

At last, I am sorry we are removing an accepted contribution which is never released. If you object, please let us know.

title: Fix bug that the same sample name in one MAL expression caused `IllegalArgumentException` in `Analyzer.analyse`
body:
### Fix - [X] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works. - [X] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it. - [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #. - [X] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md). ### Bug scene: When I used MAL expression in `yaml` like: 
exp: node_cpu_seconds_total.sum(['node_identifier_host_name']) - node_cpu_seconds_total.tagEqual('mode', 'idle').sum(['node_identifier_host_name'])
Then caused `IllegalArgumentException` in `Analyzer.analyse`. Because there 2 same sample name in the list of `ExpressionParsingContext.samples`: 
[0]'node_cpu_seconds_total' 
[1]'node_cpu_seconds_total'
When in `Analyzer.analyse` try to buid `ImmutableMap` caused `IllegalArgumentException`: 
ImmutableMap input = samples.stream().map(s -> Tuple.of(s, sampleFamilies.get(s)))
            .filter(t -> t._2 != null).collect(ImmutableMap.toImmutableMap(t -> t._1, t -> t._2));
### How to fix: Add codes in `Expression.empower`, add the metricName to `ExpressionParsingContext.samples` only if it doesn't contained.

### Add node information from the Openensus proto to the labels of the samples, to support the identification of the source host of the metric data
- [ ] If this is non-trivial feature, paste the links/URLs to the design doc.
- [x] Update the documentation to include this new feature.
- [ ] Tests(including UT, IT, E2E) are added to verify the new feature.
- [ ] If it's UI related, attach the screenshots below.


- [ ] If this pull request closes/resolves/fixes an existing issue, replace the issue number. Closes #<issue number>.
- [x] Update the [`CHANGES` log](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/CHANGES.md).

When I used the otel-receiver-plugin to receive prometheus node_exporter data forwarded from the otel-collector, 
I found that there is no label of the data source host in the samples, so I can't use MAL to do aggregation analysis by host,
unless I configure additional labels in otel-collector config.yaml, But then the label will be on each metrics.

In <opencensus.proto.agent.common.v1.Node>, node information is already carried, included  the host name.

So I add a labelkey 'node_identifier_host_name' to the collected data samples, the labelvalue is from 
<Node.identifier.host_name>, to support the identification of the source host of the metric data.

title: Fix bug in `parseInternalErrorCode` where some error codes are never reached
body:
<!--
    ⚠️ Please make sure to read this template first, pull requests that don't accord with this template
    maybe closed without notice.
    Texts surrounded by `<` and `>` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. <framework name>, <issue number>.
    Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]`
-->

### Fix bug in `parseInternalErrorCode` where some error codes are never reached
- [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.
`responseFlags.getUnauthorizedDetails()` will return a default instance, hence `responseFlags.getUnauthorizedDetails() != null` is always true, causing following conditions never reached

Generated Class: `io.envoyproxy.envoy.data.accesslog.v3.ResponseFlags`

```java
  public io.envoyproxy.envoy.data.accesslog.v3.ResponseFlags.Unauthorized getUnauthorizedDetails() {
    return unauthorizedDetails_ == null ? io.envoyproxy.envoy.data.accesslog.v3.ResponseFlags.Unauthorized.getDefaultInstance() : unauthorizedDetails_;
  }
```

title: Fix memory leak that tag may cause
body:
### Fix <bug description or the bug issue number or bug issue link>
- [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works.
- [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.


I think it is meaningless for tags to have multiple tags with the same key and value, so I suggest changing the tag type to set.
Problem scenario :  If there is a thread that has always existed, the method called by the thread is intercepted by us. When creating a tag, it will cause the risk of memory leaks.

title: Make source builder set service name and endpoint name in right order
body:
<!--
    ⚠️ Please make sure to read this template first, pull requests that don't accord with this template
    maybe closed without notice.
    Texts surrounded by `<` and `>` are meant to be replaced by you, e.g. <framework name>, <issue number>.
    Put an `x` in the `[ ]` to mark the item as CHECKED. `[x]`
-->

### Fix https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/6185
- [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works.
- [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.
       `EndpointGroupingRule#format`  depends on service name to getting the rule, but we don't set service name in advance before setting endpoint name, which leads to fail to get the endpoint group rules of the service.
      The fix solution is the `SourceBuilder` class provides a method naming `prepare` to do the name formatting and endpoint grouping action, and delay the `prepare` operation in `MultiScopesAnalysisListener#build`.

- [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works.
- [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.

Fix `timeBucket` not taking effect in EqualsAndHashCode annotation, Because the hashcode and equals methods generated by EqualsAndHashCode do not contain the properties of the parent class, the data related to the topology map is inaccurate during aggregation. use https://github.com/zifeihan/friday look runtime class info in jvm.

before fix:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16839929/103904285-0c38ce80-5138-11eb-9094-c568303726d3.png)
after fix:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16839929/103904583-6c2f7500-5138-11eb-9abb-d0dfc0abb46d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16839929/103904659-849f8f80-5138-11eb-95da-88dff2573858.png)

title: Fix mssql-plugin occur ClassCastException when call the method of return generate key
body:
### Fix mssql-plugin occur ClassCastException when call the method of return generate key
- [ ] Add a unit test to verify that the fix works.
- [x] Explain briefly why the bug exists and how to fix it.
     
fix https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/6080, 
Previously, I wrapped the return value of the prepareStatement method of SWPreparedStatement type, but in the method `com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerConnection#prepareStatement(java.lang.String, int, com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatementColumnEncryptionSetting)` , Type conversion, a `java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.trace.SWPreparedStatement cannot be cast to com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerPreparedStatement`, fix method: using the interceptor to replace wrapper.
